appendix.title: DocBook Documentation Generation
appendix.para: You may want to generate it by yourself in order to produce XHTML or PDF output.

sect2.title: Tiny DocBook Install
sect2.para: Uncompress the tiny-docbook-1-6-16.tar.bz2 archive somewhere in your filesystem.

Execute:
$ ./configure --enable-install $ make install to install and configure Tiny DocBook environment.

sect2.title: JAI Install
sect2.para:
For PNG support with PDF generation you will also need to install JAI. If you don't plan to produce PDF, you could jump to next step, otherwise process as following:
Retrieve JAI archive from Sun site, (took the classpath one for your platform).
Uncompress it in your Tiny DocBook install dir:
$ tar xvzf jai-1_1_2_01-lib-linux-i586.tar.gz
Move jai-1_1_2_01/lib/jai_codec.jar and jai-1_1_2_01/lib/jai_core.jar to fop/lib .
$ mv jai-1_1_2_01/lib/jai_codec.jar fop/lib/ $ mv jai-1_1_2_01/lib/jai_core.jar fop/lib/
Remove the becoming useless JAI archive, like that: $ rm -rf jai-1_1_2_01*

sect2.title: Create a Symbolic Link to Documentation Source
sect2.para: Create a symbolic link in the Tiny DocBook install directory pointing to the CartoWeb documentation sources <cartoweb_home>/documentation/user_manual/source , like that: $ ln -s CARTOWEB_HOME/documentation/user_manual/source

sect2.title: XHTML Generation
sect2.para:
Then, to generate an XHTML version of the documentation, execute as follow:
$ ./configure $ make xhtml Output result will be generated in xhtml/ directory.

sect2.title: PDF Generation
sect2.para:
To generate a pdf version of the documentation, execute instead:
$ ./configure $ make pdf Resulting pdf will be generated in book.pdf file.
You need to have at least a JRE (or JDK ) installed on your system in order to generate PDF . The environment variable JAVA_HOME must also be rightly set, e.g
$ export JAVA_HOME=dir_path_where_jre_is_put_on_your_system

sect1.title: Documentation Generation on Windows using Cygwin
sect1.para: At this time, the only known way to generate xhml or pdf version of the documentation on Windows is by using Cygwin.

You will need to install the following Cygwin packages:
libxml2, libxslt, make
.
Then follow the same instructions as for UNIX-like system .
